intro: Desmopsis lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf desmopsis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it requires careful management due to its potential invasiveness.
